channel.title: Homepage on Tactical Typos
channel.description: Recent content in Homepage on Tactical Typos

item.title: Money That is Quickly Gained is Quickly Lost, Payroll Psychology, and Consumerism
item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: Summary: In this post, I present a hypothetical error that humans may make when they receive their monthly or bi-weekly paychecks and explore how the error might help the economy but cause workers to suffer.

item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: And homelessness ([[notes/Houselessness|houselessness]]) Project idea - “Homes of the homeless” Interviewing currently homeless and ex-homeless persons about their concept of home, what it means to them, if it’s bound to housing that’s theirs or if they had a sense of it while living unhoused.

item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: Idea - insure against it, fund lobbyists for affordability Homelessness insurance - insuring against potential to lose your house, lodging. Insurers can lobby in favor of house affordability.

item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: “I have contributed already to my fellow man by paying my taxes. [I have done my part.] Why need I care yet more?

item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: Aspire to compose a personal theory and practice of time budgeting, one which others may learn from Log your time to record not just your plan of action but also how you actually acted.

item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: A wildly inefficient but nonetheless fun and sometimes funny way to learn and practice Spanish. Use phonetics, rhyming, vocabulary, and creativity to play with the languages of English and Spanish.

item.title: Independent Scholarship
item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: Drilling into what it means to be a scholar, irrespective of whether you’re affiliated with an academic institution or not.

item.title: Writing about experiences
item.author: brandon@tacticaltypos.net (Brandon Hall)
item.description: I think it’s important for people to record and discuss how they feeling at different stages of development and familiarity with a thing, especially for endeavors that others may undertake, either ones that are exactly the same (like a linear video game, watching a movie or reading a story) or one that’s just similar in kind (learning a programming language, navigating relationship).
